intro: Rhynchospora colorata, commonly known as the purple moor grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetlands and marshy areas in North America. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, cylindrical stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that are usually pink to purple in color, giving it its common name. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often with a bluish-green hue. Rhynchospora colorata is adapted to moist, acidic soils and plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems.
